core-v1alpha1-Duration.description: Duration is a wrapper for time.Duration that implements JSON marshalling and openapi scheme.

core-v1alpha1-TypedObjectReference.description: TypedObjectReference is a reference to a typed kubernetes object.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the group and version for the resource being referenced. If APIVersion is not specified, the specified Kind must be in the core API group. For any other third-party types, APIVersion is required.

kind.description: Kind is the type of resource being referenced

name.description: Name is the name of the kubernetes object.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of kubernetes object.

utils-continuousreconcile-ContinuousReco.description: ContinuousReconcileSpec represents the specification of a continuous reconcile schedule.

cron.description: Cron is a standard crontab specification of the reconciliation schedule. Either Cron or Every has to be specified.

every.description: Every specifies a delay after which the reconcile should happen. Either Cron or Every has to be specified.

utils-managedresource-Export.description: Export describes one export that is read from a resource.

fromObjectRef.description: FromObjectReference describes that the jsonpath points to a object reference where the actual value is read from. This is helpful if for example a deployed resource referenced a secret and that exported value is in that secret.

fromResource.description: FromResource specifies the name of the resource where the value should be read.

jsonPath.description: JSONPath is the jsonpath to look for a value. The JSONPath root is the referenced resource

key.description: Key is the key that the value from JSONPath is exported to.

utils-managedresource-Exports.description: Exports describes one export that is read from a resource.

utils-managedresource-FromObjectReferenc.description: FromObjectReference describes that the jsonpath points to a object reference where the actual value is read from. This is helpful if for example a deployed resource referenced a secret and that exported value is in that secret.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the group and version for the resource being referenced. If APIVersion is not specified, the specified Kind must be in the core API group. For any other third-party types, APIVersion is required.

jsonPath.description: JSONPath is the jsonpath to look for a value. The JSONPath root is the referenced resource

kind.description: Kind is the type of resource being referenced

utils-managedresource-Manifest.description: Manifest defines a manifest that is managed by the deployer.

annotateBeforeCreate.description: AnnotateBeforeCreate defines annotations that are being set before the manifest is being created.

annotateBeforeDelete.description: AnnotateBeforeDelete defines annotations that are being set before the manifest is being deleted.

manifest.description: Manifest defines the raw k8s manifest.

policy.description: Policy defines the manage policy for that resource.

utils-readinesschecks-CustomReadinessChe.description: CustomReadinessCheckConfiguration contains the configuration for a custom readiness check

labelSelector.description: Labels are the labels used to identify multiple resources that can be identified by a unique set of labels

name.description: Name is the name of the ReadinessCheck

requirements.description: Requirements is the actual readiness check which compares an object's property to a value

resourceSelector.description: Resource is the resource for which the readiness check should be applied, used for single resources that can be identified by namespace and name

utils-readinesschecks-LabelSelectorSpec.description: LabelSelectorSpec contains paramters used to select objects by their labels

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the API version of the object to be selected by labels

kind.description: Kind is the Kind of the object to be selected by labels

matchLabels.description: Labels are the labels used to identify multiple resources of the given kind

utils-readinesschecks-ReadinessCheckConf.description: ReadinessCheckConfiguration contains the configuration for readiness checks.

custom.description: CustomReadinessChecks is a set of custom readiness check configurations

disableDefault.description: DisableDefault allows to disable the default readiness checks.

utils-readinesschecks-RequirementSpec.description: RequirementSpec contains the requirements an object must meet to pass the custom readiness check

jsonPath.description: JsonPath is the path of the field of the Kubernetes object to be checked (without braces)

operator.description: Operator is the operator that should be used for the check can be any of these Kubernetes selection operators: DoesNotExist, Exists, Equals, DoubleEquals, NotEquals, In, NotIn

values.description: In huge majority of cases we have at most one value here. It is generally faster to operate on a single-element slice than on a single-element map, so we have a slice here.

description: ProviderConfiguration is the manifest deployer configuration that is expected in a DeployItem

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

continuousReconcile.description: ContinuousReconcile contains the schedule for continuous reconciliation.

exports.description: Exports describe the exports from the templated manifests that should be exported by the helm deployer.

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

kubeconfig.description: Kubeconfig is the base64 encoded kubeconfig file. By default the configured target is used to deploy the resources

manifests.description: Manifests contains a list of manifests that should be applied in the target cluster

updateStrategy.description: UpdateStrategy defines the strategy how the manifest are updated in the cluster. Defaults to "update".

title: manifest-v1alpha2-ProviderConfiguration
